field.name: description
field.value:
When PrototypeWebValidator renders validation attributes to CSS class names, regular expression validations are rendered to something like "validate-regex-^\w+$". Such class names are not valid (in general) and aren't recognized by validation library.
Proposed patch changes this to more "normal" behavior by rendering custom validator before form closing tag. The only tricky thing is names of generated CSS classes - they are postfixed with Regex's hash code, since I did not found anything else in calling context that can be used to produce unique class name - as a result we get something like "validate-regex-128376" in resulting HTML.
